New Records: Finn Allen equaled the world record of 16 sixes in a T20I innings, the highest score by a New Zealander in T20I history, beating Brendon McCullum's 123
Key Match Events: Finn Allen hit 16 sixes, including two that traveled over 100 meters, in New Zealand's 224-7 total. Pakistan struggled to chase 179-7, with Babar Azam scoring 58 but receiving little support
Pre-Game Insights: The match was the third of a five-match series, with New Zealand leading 2-0 after the second match
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand secured a 3-0 series win, moving towards the World Cup, while Pakistan's batting struggled despite Babar Azam's efforts
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the University Oval, with two of Allen's sixes traveling over 100 meters, and Haris Rauf conceding 28 runs in two overs
Others: Pakistan has won only one of its last eight T20I matches as it heads to the World Cup
